Posts.Content: Apr 29, 2008 10:03AM frogger wrote: hi gals, thanks for all the encouragement. i know that once the lymph system backs up and you don't get ahead of it it can start to back up other places. my therapist told me the other day that if we get it under control and keep it under control that she would talk to me again about going back mt in about 6 mth when my tx is finished. in the mean time she would like to get me some better quality of life since i have le so soon after surgery and starting chemo her goal she said is to be able to function at home by myself and take of my childern. i have very limited rom in my arm and have alot of trouble lifting. god love mom on laundry days, bath time and for big meals. thanks for all the words of encouragement some days i think i've lost my mind between my appt and getting braces on the 12 y/o.Â soory i think i am ramblingÂ

Posts.Content: May 5, 2008 10:39PM frogger wrote: hi ladies, sorry having a bad weekend after chemo . my hair started to come out on day 14 same day as my 2nd chemo,but it was my 2 y/o that pulled out the first clump. from there things went down hill. i cried most of the weekend which made me sick to my stomach, the 12y/o only whined about her braces all w/e. finally broke down and shaved what hair i have left and now am told i look like my brother. roberta37- as to your son i would make sure the school is doing what they should to help your son and not just saying he is not doing his work. they have all sorts of resources these days to help child deal and cope with any situation hope everyone is doing well and take care
